ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Retrocochlear pathology
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, unilateral tinnitus, and disproportionately poor word recognition scores (42% in the right ear) suggest retrocochlear involvement.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral sloping loss with family history suggests a cochlear component, but the asymmetry and poor speech discrimination require ruling out retrocochlear causes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration.
To assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient presents with bilateral asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss, sloping from normal in the low frequencies to severe/profound in the high frequencies, with the right ear being significantly worse. Word recognition in the right ear is very poor (42%) and disproportionate to the pure-tone thresholds compared to the left ear (82%). Tympanometry is normal, but acoustic reflexes show abnormalities consistent with the asymmetry.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal at 250 Hz sloping to profound SNHL at 6-8 kHz. Left ear: Normal at 250 Hz sloping to severe SNHL at 8 kHz. Asymmetric configuration.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT agrees with PTA (RT 50 dB, LT 40 dB). WRS is 42% in the right ear (very poor) and 82% in the left ear.

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Right ipsilateral normal at 500 Hz, elevated/absent higher. Left ipsilateral normal 500-2000 Hz. Contralateral reflexes absent/elevated. Decay negative where measurable.

counseling_actions: Discuss the asymmetric hearing loss and the disproportionate reduction in speech clarity in the right ear.
Explain that amplification may not improve clarity in the right ear due to the nature of the loss.
Advise on the need for medical referral to rule out retrocochlear pathology.

red_flags_present: Disproportionately poor word recognition score in the right ear

escalation.rationale_short: Referral for MRI to rule out retrocochlear pathology due to asymmetric loss and poor WRS.

follow_up_plan.objective: Follow up for hearing aid programming and HAT after medical clearance.
